Culinary Profile & Uses

1. Flavour and Form ‘Sky-Blue’ offers an intense, clean cucumber flavor with subtle sweet and mineral notes. The flowers are the signature true blue, star-shaped blooms that maintain their vibrant color, while the leaves are smaller, more tender, and less bristly than standard borage. The plant forms a dense, rounded mound 25-30 cm in height and spread, with multiple branching stems that keep the iconic flowers displayed prominently.

2. The Refreshing Cucumber Accent This borage’s vibrant color and crisp flavor make it exceptionally versatile for both culinary and beverage applications.

  • Signature Cocktail Garnish: The ultimate use - floating a single star-shaped flower in summer drinks, lemonades, or gin and tonics for stunning visual appeal and subtle cucumber essence.
  • Salads and Desserts: Scattered over green salads, fruit salads, or light desserts to add bursts of color and refreshing flavor.
  • Flower Ice Cubes: Frozen into ice cubes or rings to transform ordinary beverages into extraordinary presentations.
  • Young Leaf Salads: The youngest, most tender leaves can be finely chopped and added to salads for a cucumber flavor boost without the texture of mature leaves.

3. The Harvest and Yield ‘Sky-Blue’ is a continuous producer when harvested regularly. Pick flowers daily as they open, choosing the freshest blooms for optimal color and flavor. Young leaves can be harvested sparingly. Supplied as a pre-seeded RFID Seed-Pad Cartridges, it provides a steady yield of 20-30 perfect blue flowers per week, with first blooms appearing just 60 days after germination and continuing until frost.
